input_text:
Job Title: Restoration Technician

Location: Omaha, NE

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
We've partnered up with a premier and respected restoration company looking to add a Water Mitigation Technician to their team that is willing to do the work. Restoration experience is required. We are open to train those with the desire to grow within the company and industry. Looking for someone with a great work ethic, positive attitude, and one who is willing to wear multiple hats with many different duties each day. This individual will need to be able to run water mitigation projects from start to finish, from securing contracts, to performing the mitigation work, closing out jobs, and submitting paperwork correctly.

This is a wonderful opportunity to grow in a lucrative field. 80% of the people now in management roles started as technicians, worked their way up through the ropes, gaining skill sets and knowledge and are now making anywhere from $80-100k a year.

Values are a BIG part of who this company is, so they really take care of their employees. It's a small, family owned business who prioritizes work-life balance. If you are looking for a chance to get into a stable restoration company, look no further.

MUST HAVE: IICRC Certification in WRT and desire to obtain more certifications

Restoration Technician Duties

Provides restoration services to residential and commercial customersCommunicating with members of the team as well as project supervisor and/or business ownerMaintaining project sites in a neat and orderly fashionCompletes assigned job tasks according to company processes while maintaining quality control on each jobBe exposed to various inside and outside working conditionsAbility to lift up to 50 poundsAble to be on your feet for long periods of timeValid drivers licenseAuthorized to work in the United States

All inquiries CONFIDENTIAL!

If you would like to learn more about this position or any other opportunities reach out to me today at: Email jaclyn.mckenzie@gogpac.com or Call 402-235-4953

All qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, age, color, sex (including pregnancy), religion, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, military status, genetic information, or any other status protected by applicable laws or regulations.

GPAC (Growing People and Companies) is an award-winning search firm specializing in placing quality professionals within multiple industries across the United States since 1990. We are extremely competitive, client-focused and realize that our value is in our ability to deliver the right solutions at the right time.

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
